com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple
Class SimpleNonVisibleComponentsPanel

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.SimpleNonVisibleComponentsPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
DropTarget, HasAttachHandlers, HasHandlers, EventListener, IsWidget
public final class SimpleNonVisibleComponentsPanel
extends Composite
implements DropTarget

Panel in the Simple design editor holding non-visible Simple components.

public SimpleNonVisibleComponentsPanel()

Method Detail

setForm

public void setForm(MockForm form)
Associates a Simple form component with this panel.

Parameters:
form - backing mocked form component

addComponent

public void addComponent(MockComponent component)
Adds a new non-visible component to this panel. Note that this method will not add the component to the form component! This needs to be done separately.

Parameters:
component - Simple mock component to be added

removeComponent

public void removeComponent(MockComponent component)
Removes a new non-visible component from this panel. Note that this method will not remove the component from the form component! This needs to be done separately.

Parameters:
component - Simple mock component to be removed

getDropTargetWidget

public Widget getDropTargetWidget()
Description copied from interface: DropTarget
Returns the GWT component associated with this DropTarget. The location of this widget is used to determine the bounds of the drop region.

This method may be called frequently.

Specified by:
getDropTargetWidget in interface DropTarget
Returns:
widget

onDragEnter

public boolean onDragEnter(DragSource source,
                           int x,
                           int y)
Description copied from interface: DropTarget
Invoked when a drag source that is currently being dragged enters the bounds of this target's widget.

Returns true if the drag source is accepted, false otherwise.

If this method accepts that drag, it is guaranteed that DropTarget.onDragContinue(DragSource, int, int) will be invoked immediately afterwards with the same x and y arguments.

Specified by:
onDragEnter in interface DropTarget
Parameters:
source - the drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget
x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
Returns:
true if the source is accepted, false otherwise

onDragContinue

public void onDragContinue(DragSource source,
                           int x,
                           int y)
Description copied from interface: DropTarget
Invoked while an accepted drag source is being dragged over this target's widget.

It is guaranteed that:

  1. this method will be invoked immediately after an invocation of DropTarget.onDragEnter(DragSource, int, int) that accepts its drag source
  2. this method will be invoked immediately before an invocation of DropTarget.onDrop(DragSource, int, int, int, int)

Specified by:
onDragContinue in interface DropTarget
Parameters:
source - the accepted drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget
x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget

onDragLeave

public void onDragLeave(DragSource source)
Description copied from interface: DropTarget
Invoked while an accepted drag source has been dragged outside the bounds of this target's widget.

Specified by:
onDragLeave in interface DropTarget
Parameters:
source - the accepted drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget

onDrop

public void onDrop(DragSource source,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int offsetX,
                   int offsetY)
Description copied from interface: DropTarget
Invoked when the user drops an accepted drag source on this target's widget.

It is guaranteed that DropTarget.onDragContinue(DragSource, int, int) will have been invoked immediately beforehand with the same x and y arguments.

Specified by:
onDrop in interface DropTarget
Parameters:
source - the accepted drag source that has been dropped on this drop target's widget
x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
offsetX - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of the drag-widget
offsetY - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of the drag-widget
